intro: Hornstedtia walang, commonly known as the Philippine hornstedtia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
